fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Budget, Competition, Consumers, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Environment, Taxation, Single market, Digital economy and society, Climate Action, Communication, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives:
Generally the IPD works on all files relating to financial services and products, in particular issues relating specifically to insurance and pension (both on pillar 1, 2 and 3 pensions).  
 
We also work on issues relating to social and labour market policies, competition, data protection, company and contract law, substantibility in the financial sector, consumer protection and financial eductaion initiatives. 
  
Moreover, we follow policies and initiatives relating to governance and decision-making processes of all EU institutions and agencies.  
 
Examples of specific issues that are important to the IPD:  
Capital Market Union, Sustainable Finance, Solvency II, ESA Review, IAIS, international capital standards, IDD, PRIIPs, IORP2, PEPP, prevention initatives, motor liability directive, service e-card, insurance and liability connected with robotics etc., the digitalisation aganda, big data, data protection, product liability directive etc.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
belgium_office_address: Insurance & Pension Denmark Rue Montoyer 51 4. floor
persons_accredited_for_access_to_europea: ALEXANDERSEN#Michael Riff, MARIA HJORT#Jakobsen, SCHOW#Dianne Louise, WINTHER#Jacob
goals__remit:
Mission of the IPD: The IPD represents the interests of the Danish non-life and life insurnace companies and industry-wide pension funds. 
 
Vision of the IPD: It is our vision that the industry is recognized as a significant player that contributes positively to the general sense of security and to solving the challengers of the welfare system.
